channel.title: Php [rep++]
channel.description: How do you make a login page send the info to your email..?

item.title: Php [rep++]
item.dc:creator: @Muroth Muroth
item.description:
@Muroth wrote:

<?php $txt = "First line of text\nSecond line of text"; // Use wordwrap() if lines are longer than 70 characters $txt = wordwrap($txt,70); // Send email mail("somebody@example.com","My subject",$txt); ?>

Fuse in your login variables ($_POST[’’])

Read full topic

item.title: Php [rep++]
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

If you just want it to email you then use PHPs mail() function, it isn’t hard to assign data they input to a variable then use it.

Read full topic

item.title: Php [rep++]
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

[quote=“P A N I C, post:4, topic:407632”][quote author=Andrew Ferguson link=topic=508909.msg3692061#msg3692061 date=1312181195]
We don’t support phishing on this website, please go to another if your going to want an answer without cuss words from others. Fair warning.
[/quote]

Not for a phish.
If you really want to know it’s for my rsps.
Donation page once you type the info into the page it submits but I need it too log the info so I know usernames…[/quote]
Well in that case you should learn about SQL servers and connecting one to your server, it would take the same amount of time and it would be all automatic. Plus I doubt any site will tell you how to make a page like you described even though you say its for something legit. It just sounds sketchy when you look at it.

Read full topic
